p:
The ORR performed on Fe or Mn site was calculated by the following theory. The four-electron pathway by which the ORR occurs under base condition are generally reported to proceed according to the following steps:
8
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathrm{O}}_2\left( {\mathrm{g}} \right) + \ast \Rightarrow {\mathrm{O}}_2^ \ast $$\end{document}
O
2
g
+ * ⇒
O
2
*
9
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathrm{O}}_2^ \ast + {\mathrm{H}}_2{\mathrm{O}}(l) + e^ - \Rightarrow {\mathrm{OOH}}^ \ast + {\mathrm{OH}}^ - $$\end{document}
O
2
*
+
H
2

(
l
)

e
−
⇒
OOH

+

\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathrm{OOH}}^ \ast + e^ - \Rightarrow {\mathrm{O}}^ \ast + {\mathrm{OH}}^ - $$\end{document}

12
\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath} \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb} \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek} \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$${\mathrm{OH}}^ \ast + e^ - \Rightarrow {\mathrm{OH}}^ - + \ast $$\end{document}

where * represents an active site on the corresponding surface.
